segments.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, ādīnavā dīghacārikaṃ anavatthacārikaṃ anuyuttassa viharato.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks for someone who likes long and aimless wandering.

segments.pli: Assutaṃ na suṇāti, sutaṃ na pariyodāpeti, sutenekaccena avisārado hoti, gāḷhaṃ rogātaṅkaṃ phusati, na ca mittavā hoti.
segments.en: You don’t learn new things. You don’t clarify what you’ve learned. You lack confidence in some things you have learned. You contract a severe illness. You don’t have any friends.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ādīnavā dīghacārikaṃ anavatthacārikaṃ anuyuttassa viharato.
segments.en: These are the five drawbacks for someone who likes long and aimless wandering.
There are these five benefits of a reasonable amount of wandering.

segments.pli: Assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, sutenekaccena visārado hoti, na gāḷhaṃ rogātaṅkaṃ phusati, mittavā ca hoti.
segments.en: You learn new things. You clarify what you’ve learned. You have confidence in some things you have learned. You don’t contract severe illness. You have friends.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ānisaṃsā samavatthacāre”ti.
segments.en: These are the five benefits of a reasonable amount of wandering.”
